title: Test: This Is The Difference Between The Most Expensive Les Paul ($8,750) And The Cheapest Les Paul ($210) [News]
text:
UG News editor since early 2013. King Crimson fan. I handle the news around here. Posted 5 hours ago 9 
Chappers and The Captain presented another interesting comparison video, putting the most expensive Les Paul guitar found in the Andertons store against the cheapest LP model in store. As you can see in the clip, Chappers used the same amp with the same settings and the same toan strap. 
Pointing out that the conclusion they have is hardly anything revolutionary, the boys noted that the affordable domain was made drastically better in recent decades. 
The Captain said: "Over the last 20 years, it's absolutely gone from you really needed to buy a relatively top-end [guitar] to avoid the crappy stuff, but now it's just kind of like, the top-end is there to treat yourself with." 
Chappers chimed in: 'It's interesting. While we were testing guitars, there's was a funny psychological thing in my mind. I was telling myself, 'Oh yeah, imagine this was one of those '60s things that was made but never actually happened, and it has a bolt-on with vintage tuners and plastic nut and I was like, 'Yeah, I could get into that vibe!' If you relic it, suddenly it's this kind of quirky, old-school Gibson, it becomes a different thing in your mind." 
You can check out the whole thing below.
